definition: ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: On that day, a large number of registrants to the site to watch Yao Hao process.
sentences.chinese: 当天有大批的登记者到现场观看摇号过程。

sentences.english: Beijing car market remains sluggish after first plate lottery .
sentences.chinese: 北京实施车牌摇号后，车市冷清。

sentences.english: Starting on Friday, car registration will be allocated by a license-plate lottery system.
sentences.chinese: 从周五开始，车辆登记将采用车牌摇号的方式进行。

sentences.english: A large number of registrants to the site to watch Yao Hao process.
sentences.chinese: 有大批的登记者到现场观看摇号过程。

definition: to randomly select (as for a lottery)/to take a number (for queuing)
to win a ballot/to draw a lucky number
to draw the winning ticket (in a lottery)
to ask to buy/to bid for purchase
to transfer ownership (of a vehicle, securities etc)/(real estate) conveyancing
to sleep in separate rooms/distribution of social housing
second-hand house/house acquired indirectly through a middle-man
